name: Ramit Sethi's Conscious Spending Plan Template
description: A template based on Ramit Sethi's 4-category conscious spending framework

fixedCosts.description: Basic expenses needed to live (50-60% of take-home pay)

transportation.description: Car payments, insurance, gas, maintenance, public transit

debt.description: Credit card minimums, student loans, other debt payments

investments.description: Long-term wealth building (10% of take-home pay)

savings.description: Short and medium-term savings goals (5-10% of take-home pay)

mediumTermGoals.description: House down payment, car replacement, major purchases

guiltFreeSpending.description: Fun money to spend on whatever you want (20-35% of take-home pay)

fixedCosts: If over 60%, look for ways to reduce housing or transportation costs
Consider location arbitrage or downsizing if necessary
investments: Pay yourself first - automate this category
Invest in low-cost index funds for long-term growth
savings: Build emergency fund first (3-6 months of expenses)
Save for specific goals with target dates
Use high-yield savings accounts for short-term goals
guiltFreeSpending: This is your fun money - spend it without guilt!
Automate the amount you want to spend
Don't feel bad about spending on things you love
If you need more, cut from other categories first

automationTips: Set up automatic transfers for each category
Use separate accounts for different savings goals
Automate investments to occur right after payday
